article: They huddled inside the storm door - two children in dirty old coats. "Any old  _  , lady?" I was  _  with my household budget . I wanted to say no --- until I looked down at their  _  . Thin little sandals ,  _  through. "Come into the front room and I'll make you a cup of hot  _  ." There was no conversation. Their wet sandals left  _  upon the hearthstone . I  _  them cocoa and bread with jam to  _  against the cold outside. Then I went back to the kitchen and started  _  on my household budget. I  _  the silence in the front room and looked in. The girl held the empty  _  in her hands, looking at it. The boy asked in a flat voice, "Lady ... are you rich?" "Am I rich? No!" The girl put her cup back in its saucer -  _  . "Your cups  _  your saucers." Her voice was old, with a  _  that was not of the stomach. They left then, holding their newspapers  _  the wind. They hadn't said  thank you  . They didn't need to. They had done more than that. Plain blue pottery cups and saucers.  _  they matched. I tasted the potatoes and stirred the gravy . Potatoes and brown gravy, a roof over our heads, my man with a good steady job - these things matched, too. I moved the chairs back from the fire and cleaned the living room. The muddy prints of small sandals were  _  wet upon my heart. I let them be. I want them there  in case  I ever forget again how very  _  I am.
